name: CVE-2022-40617
description: strongSwan before 5.9.8 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service in the revocation plugin by sending a crafted end-entity (and intermediate CA) certificate that contains a CRL/OCSP URL that points to a server (under the attacker's control) that doesn't properly respond but (for example) just does nothing after the initial TCP handshake, or sends an excessive amount of application data.
pattern: [(software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:strongswan:strongswan:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') OR (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:canonical:ubuntu_linux:18.04:*:*:*:lts:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:canonical:ubuntu_linux:14.04:*:*:*:esm:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:canonical:ubuntu_linux:20.04:*:*:*:lts:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:canonical:ubuntu_linux:16.04:*:*:*:esm:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:canonical:ubuntu_linux:22.04:*:*:*:lts:*:*:*') OR (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:debian:debian_linux:10.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:debian:debian_linux:11.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*')]

external_references.description: This object was created using cve2stix from the Signals Corps.
